intro: Peristylus duthiei var. inayatii, commonly known as the Inayat's peristylus, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of South Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
